chapters.description: Understand the principles, values, and practices of DevOps. Explore the history and evolution of DevOps.
chapters.goal: Define DevOps and its core concepts.
chapters.mini_project: Create a simple document outlining your understanding of DevOps principles.

chapters.description: Learn about the CI/CD pipeline, its stages, and the tools used for automation. Explore version control systems like Git.
chapters.goal: Understand the CI/CD pipeline and its benefits.
chapters.mini_project: Set up a basic Git repository and practice committing and pushing changes.

chapters.description: Introduction to cloud computing concepts, service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), and popular cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP).
chapters.goal: Understand the fundamentals of cloud computing and its relevance to DevOps.
chapters.mini_project: Create a free account on a cloud platform and explore its basic services.

chapters.description: Explore the concept of IaC, its benefits, and popular tools like Terraform and Ansible.
chapters.goal: Understand the principles and benefits of IaC.
chapters.mini_project: Define a basic infrastructure configuration using Terraform or Ansible.

chapters.description: Learn how to provision and manage resources on popular cloud platforms using IaC tools. Explore concepts like modules and variables.
chapters.goal: Provision and configure resources on a cloud platform using IaC.
chapters.mini_project: Deploy a simple web server on a cloud platform using IaC.

chapters.description: Understand the concept of containers, their benefits, and how they differ from virtual machines. Explore Docker and its core concepts.
chapters.mini_project: Create a Docker image for a simple application.

chapters.description: Learn about Kubernetes, its architecture, and how it manages containerized applications. Explore concepts like deployments, pods, and services.
chapters.goal: Deploy and manage containerized applications using Kubernetes.
chapters.mini_project: Deploy a multi-container application using Kubernetes.

chapters.description: Explore popular DevOps monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and Datadog. Learn about metrics, dashboards, and alerts.
chapters.goal: Understand the basics of DevOps monitoring.
chapters.mini_project: Set up a basic monitoring dashboard using Prometheus and Grafana.

chapters.description: Learn about log management tools like ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) and Graylog. Explore log analysis techniques and troubleshooting.
chapters.goal: Understand log management principles and analyze logs for insights.
chapters.mini_project: Configure a basic log pipeline using ELK Stack or Graylog.

chapters.description: Learn the fundamentals of shell scripting using Bash. Explore common commands, variables, loops, and conditional statements.
chapters.goal: Write basic shell scripts for automation tasks.
chapters.mini_project: Automate a simple task using a Bash script.

chapters.description: Learn Python basics and its applications in DevOps. Explore libraries like requests, json, and os.
chapters.goal: Use Python for basic DevOps automation tasks.
chapters.mini_project: Write a Python script to automate a simple configuration task.

chapters.description: Research and select a relevant DevOps certification based on your career goals. Popular options include AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer Expert, and Google Cloud Certified Professional DevOps Engineer.
chapters.mini_project: Create a study plan for your chosen certification.

chapters.description: Utilize online courses, practice exams, and study guides to prepare for the certification exam. Focus on key concepts and hands-on skills.
chapters.goal: Pass the chosen DevOps certification exam.
chapters.mini_project: Take a practice exam for your chosen certification.
